title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Leviticus chapter 7 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Leviticus Chapter 7.

questions.question: Where shall the trespass offering be killed according to Leviticus 7?
options: In the place where they kill the burnt offering
In the holy place
Outside the camp
In the priest's house
questions.correctAnswer: In the place where they kill the burnt offering
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:2 states that the trespass offering shall be killed in the place where they kill the burnt offering.

questions.question: What parts of the trespass offering are to be offered as fat on the altar?
options: The rump, kidneys, caul, and fat covering the inwards
Only the rump and kidneys
Only the caul and liver
The whole animal
questions.correctAnswer: The rump, kidneys, caul, and fat covering the inwards
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:3-4 instructs to offer the fat including the rump, fat covering the inwards, two kidneys, and caul above the liver.

questions.question: Who is allowed to eat the fat of the trespass offering?
options: Every male among the priests
All the Israelites
Only the sacrifice offerer
The Levites only
questions.correctAnswer: Every male among the priests
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:6 states that every male among the priests shall eat the fat of the trespass offering.

questions.question: True or False: The priest who offers a burnt offering receives the skin of the burnt offering.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:8 clearly states that the priest who offers a burnt offering shall have the skin of that burnt offering.

questions.question: What kind of cakes are offered with a sacrifice of thanksgiving?
options: Unleavened cakes mingled with oil
Leavened cakes without oil
Only unleavened bread
Sweet cakes with honey
questions.correctAnswer: Unleavened cakes mingled with oil
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:12 specifies that unleavened cakes mingled with oil are offered with the sacrifice of thanksgiving.

questions.question: When must the flesh of the thanksgiving peace offering be eaten?
options: The same day it is offered
Within three days
After one week
After the morning of the next day
questions.correctAnswer: The same day it is offered
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:15 commands that the flesh of the thanksgiving peace offering be eaten the same day it is offered.

questions.question: What happens to the remainder of the flesh of the offering on the third day?
options: It shall be burnt with fire
It is to be eaten
It shall be buried
It should be given to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be burnt with fire
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:17 states that the remainder of the flesh on the third day shall be burnt with fire.

questions.question: True or False: Eating the flesh of the peace offering on the third day is acceptable.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:18 says eating the flesh on the third day is an abomination and will not be accepted.

questions.question: What must not touch the flesh of the peace offerings for it to be eaten?
options: Anything unclean
Water
Fire
Oil
questions.correctAnswer: Anything unclean
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:19 states that flesh that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten but burnt.

questions.question: What is the consequence for a soul that eats the flesh of peace offerings with uncleanness on them?
options: They shall be cut off from their people
They shall be forgiven
They shall offer another sacrifice
They shall be fined
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be cut off from their people
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:20 states that any soul eating the flesh with uncleanness shall be cut off from his people.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Ye shall eat no manner of _____, of ox, or of sheep, or of goat.'
options: fat
meat
blood
skin
questions.correctAnswer: fat
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:23 commands the children of Israel to eat no manner of fat of ox, sheep, or goat.

questions.question: True or False: It is permitted to eat the fat of beasts that die of themselves.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:24 and 7:25 forbid eating the fat of beasts that die of themselves or torn by beasts.

questions.question: What shall no man eat according to Leviticus 7:26?
options: No manner of blood
No manner of fat
No meat offering
No unleavened bread
questions.correctAnswer: No manner of blood
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:26 clearly states that no manner of blood, whether of fowl or beast, shall be eaten.

questions.question: Who receives the right shoulder of the peace offerings as a heave offering?
options: The priest
The offerer
The Levites
The elders
questions.correctAnswer: The priest
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:32 states that the right shoulder shall be given unto the priest as a heave offering.

questions.question: What is the statute regarding the wave breast and heave shoulder from the children of Israel?
options: Given to Aaron and his sons forever
Given to the elders for distribution
Given to the Levites temporarily
Returned to the offerer
questions.correctAnswer: Given to Aaron and his sons forever
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:34 states that the wave breast and heave shoulder are given to Aaron and his sons by a statute forever.

medium.title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Leviticus Chapter 7 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is confused about the holiness required in offering a trespass offering. Based on Leviticus 7, what is the appropriate attitude toward such an offering?
options: It is most holy and must be treated with reverence
It can be offered casually without much concern
It is less holy than other offerings
It can be offered anywhere without restrictions
questions.correctAnswer: It is most holy and must be treated with reverence
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:1 states that the law of the trespass offering is most holy, emphasizing reverence and proper treatment. This is supported by the instructions on handling and eating it in verses 5-7.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 7 instruct believers to handle the fat of the trespass offering, and what spiritual principle can we learn about giving our best to God?
options: Offer all the fat upon the altar as an offering made by fire
Keep the fat for personal use
Give the fat to the poor
Burn the fat outside the camp
questions.correctAnswer: Offer all the fat upon the altar as an offering made by fire
questions.explanation: Verses 3-5 describe offering all the fat of the trespass offering on the altar. This teaches us about giving God our best and honoring Him with the finest parts of our lives.

questions.question: A new believer asks about the priest’s portion in offerings. According to Leviticus 7, what is the general rule for the priest's share?
options: The priest eats the most holy portions in the holy place
The priest does not receive any portion
The priest only receives the skin of burnt offerings
The priest shares portions equally with the people
questions.correctAnswer: The priest eats the most holy portions in the holy place
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:6 and 7:8 clarify that priests eat the most holy parts, including the fat and skins, in the holy place, symbolizing their role in mediating between God and the people.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 7 teach about generosity and fairness among the priests concerning meat offerings?
options: All sons of Aaron share equally in dry and oil-mingled meat offerings
Only the eldest son receives the meat offerings
The meat offerings are given only to the high priest
Meat offerings must be sold and the money shared
questions.correctAnswer: All sons of Aaron share equally in dry and oil-mingled meat offerings
questions.explanation: Verse 10 states that all sons of Aaron share equally in these offerings, teaching fairness and unity in stewardship among servants of God.

questions.question: A believer preparing a peace offering wants to understand the right way to offer thanksgiving. What does Leviticus 7 instruct about the accompanying bread and cakes?
options: Offer unleavened cakes mingled with oil, unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and fried cakes
Offer only leavened bread without oil
Offer unleavened bread with honey
Offer any bread without specific requirements
questions.correctAnswer: Offer unleavened cakes mingled with oil, unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and fried cakes
questions.explanation: Verses 12-13 describe specific offerings of unleavened cakes and leavened bread with oil for thanksgiving, highlighting the importance of obedience and honoring God with proper offerings.

questions.question: What principle about stewardship and promptness in using God’s gifts can we learn from the instructions on eating peace offerings in Leviticus 7?
options: Eat the flesh the same day it is offered and do not keep it overnight
Store the offering for several days before eating
Give the offering to strangers instead of eating it
Burn all the flesh immediately after offering
questions.correctAnswer: Eat the flesh the same day it is offered and do not keep it overnight
questions.explanation: Verses 15-16 instruct that the flesh of peace offerings be eaten the same day or the next day, teaching promptness and respect for God’s provisions without delay or neglect.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 7 warn believers about the consequences of eating the flesh of peace offerings on the third day or if it touches unclean things?
options: It will be an abomination and not accepted by God
There are no consequences mentioned
It is acceptable if the person repents later
The offering should just be burned without penalty
questions.correctAnswer: It will be an abomination and not accepted by God
questions.explanation: Verses 17-21 warn that eating the flesh on the third day or if it is defiled results in it being an abomination and the soul bearing guilt, emphasizing holiness and purity in God’s service.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 7 teaches that all fat from ox, sheep, or goats may be eaten by the Israelites.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verses 23-25 explicitly forbid eating fat from ox, sheep, or goats, especially fat offered by fire to the LORD, teaching obedience to God's dietary holiness laws.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 7, what is the consequence for anyone who eats blood, whether of fowl or beast?
options: They shall be cut off from their people
They will be forgiven if they repent
They should offer a sacrifice to atone
There is no specific consequence mentioned
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be cut off from their people
questions.explanation: Verses 26-27 clearly state that anyone who eats blood shall be cut off from their people, underscoring the seriousness of respecting God's commands.

questions.question: A believer serving in ministry wonders about the portion of the peace offerings given to priests. What does Leviticus 7 say about the breast and right shoulder of these offerings?
options: The breast is waved as a wave offering and belongs to Aaron and his sons; the right shoulder is given as a heave offering to the priest
Both the breast and shoulder belong to the people
They must be burned entirely on the altar
They are given to the poor, not the priests
questions.correctAnswer: The breast is waved as a wave offering and belongs to Aaron and his sons; the right shoulder is given as a heave offering to the priest
questions.explanation: Verses 29-34 describe the breast and right shoulder portions given to priests as their lawful portion, teaching about honoring those who serve God.

questions.question: True or False: Leviticus 7 teaches that the portion of the offerings given to Aaron and his sons is a statute forever.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 34-36 affirm that the portion of offerings given to Aaron and his sons is a statute forever, emphasizing God's established order and faithfulness in provision for His servants.

questions.question: How does Leviticus 7 emphasize the importance of personal responsibility in offering sacrifices?
options: The offerer must bring the offering with his own hands
Anyone can bring the offering on behalf of another
Offerings can be bought by priests from the market
Offerings should be left at the altar without personal involvement
questions.correctAnswer: The offerer must bring the offering with his own hands
questions.explanation: Verse 30 states that the person offering peace offerings must bring the offerings with his own hands, teaching personal devotion and responsibility in worship.

questions.question: A believer wants to learn about holiness in daily life from Leviticus 7. What does the chapter teach about eating meat that touches unclean things?
options: It shall not be eaten but must be burned with fire
It is acceptable if cooked thoroughly
It should be given to the priests
It can be eaten if blessed
questions.correctAnswer: It shall not be eaten but must be burned with fire
questions.explanation: Verse 19 commands that flesh touching unclean things must be burned, teaching the importance of separation from uncleanness and maintaining holiness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Leviticus 7, the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten the same day it is offered; he shall not leave any of it until the ________.
options: morning
evening
next week
third day
questions.correctAnswer: morning
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:15 teaches that the flesh must be eaten the same day and not left until the morning, emphasizing respect for God's offerings and promptness in obedience.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with the discipline of holiness in daily eating habits. Based on Leviticus 7, what biblical truth would you share regarding eating consecrated food and uncleanness?
options: Only those clean and without uncleanness may eat the flesh of peace offerings
It is acceptable to eat consecrated food regardless of uncleanness
Unclean people can eat if they wash before
Consecrated food is only symbolic and can be eaten anytime
questions.correctAnswer: Only those clean and without uncleanness may eat the flesh of peace offerings
questions.explanation: Verses 19-21 emphasize that only those who are clean may eat the flesh of peace offerings, and anyone with uncleanness who eats it shall be cut off, teaching holiness and reverence in daily life.

questions.question: How does the instruction on offering the fat and the breast in Leviticus 7 reflect the biblical virtue of gratitude and worship?
options: The fat is burned on the altar and the breast is given to the priests as a wave offering
Both are kept by the offerer for personal use
They are given to the poor as a sign of charity
They are discarded as unclean parts
questions.correctAnswer: The fat is burned on the altar and the breast is given to the priests as a wave offering
questions.explanation: Verses 30-31 explain the fat is burned for the LORD and the breast is waved and given to priests, symbolizing gratitude, worship, and recognition of God’s provision and service.

hard.title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Leviticus Chapter 7.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 7, what part of the trespass offering is burned on the altar as an offering made by fire unto the LORD?
options: The fat including the rump, kidneys, and caul
The meat of the offering
The skin of the offering
The entire animal
questions.correctAnswer: The fat including the rump, kidneys, and caul
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:3-5 instructs that all the fat, including the rump, kidneys, and the caul above the liver, shall be taken away and burned upon the altar as a trespass offering.

questions.question: In Leviticus 7, who is permitted to eat the meat of the trespass offering?
options: Every male among the priests in the holy place
All the children of Israel
Only the high priest
The person who offered the trespass offering
questions.correctAnswer: Every male among the priests in the holy place
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:6 states that every male among the priests shall eat of the trespass offering and it shall be eaten in the holy place, emphasizing its most holy status.

questions.question: What is the significance of the priest having the skin of the burnt offering in Leviticus 7?
options: It is the priest's portion as part of his due
It signifies the priest's atonement for the people
It is to be burned with the fat
It is given to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: It is the priest's portion as part of his due
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:8 states that the priest who offers any man's burnt offering shall have the skin of the burnt offering as his own, highlighting the priest's share in the offerings.

questions.question: How are the meat offerings that are baked or cooked to be distributed according to Leviticus 7?
options: They belong to the priest who offers them
They are to be eaten by the whole congregation
They must be burned completely
They are given to the poor and widows
questions.correctAnswer: They belong to the priest who offers them
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:9 explains that all meat offerings baked in the oven or prepared in a frying pan or pan belong to the priest who offers them.

questions.question: What offerings are described in Leviticus 7:12-13 as accompanying a thanksgiving peace offering?
options: Unleavened cakes mingled with oil, unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and leavened bread
Only unleavened bread without oil
Unleavened bread and wine
Leavened cakes without oil
questions.correctAnswer: Unleavened cakes mingled with oil, unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and leavened bread
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:12-13 specifies that a thanksgiving peace offering includes unleavened cakes mingled with oil, unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and leavened bread together.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 7, what must be done with the flesh of the peace offerings for thanksgiving if it is not eaten the same day?
options: It must not be left until morning and is to be eaten the same day
It may be eaten within three days
It can be stored for a week
It must be burned immediately
questions.correctAnswer: It must not be left until morning and is to be eaten the same day
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:15 commands that the flesh of the peace offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten the same day and shall not be left until the morning.

questions.question: What consequence does Leviticus 7 specify for anyone who eats the flesh of peace offerings on the third day?
options: It shall not be accepted and is an abomination, and the soul bears iniquity
They must offer a sin offering
They shall be forgiven if they confess
They are to be excluded for seven days
questions.correctAnswer: It shall not be accepted and is an abomination, and the soul bears iniquity
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:18 states that eating the flesh of peace offerings on the third day is an abomination not accepted by God, and the soul that eats it bears its iniquity.

questions.question: Leviticus 7:19-21 forbids eating the flesh of peace offerings that have touched what kind of thing?
options: Anything unclean
Anything leavened
Any grain offering
Any burnt offering
questions.correctAnswer: Anything unclean
questions.explanation: Verses 19-21 emphasize that flesh touching unclean things, including unclean persons, beasts, or abominable things, must not be eaten and offenders are cut off from their people.

questions.question: What does Leviticus 7:23-25 prohibit the Israelites from eating, and what is the penalty for disobedience?
options: Fat of ox, sheep, or goat; the soul that eats it shall be cut off
Blood of any animal; the soul that eats it shall be blessed
Leavened bread; the soul that eats it shall be forgiven
The skin of the burnt offering; the soul that eats it shall be anointed
questions.correctAnswer: Fat of ox, sheep, or goat; the soul that eats it shall be cut off
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:23-25 commands not to eat any fat of ox, sheep, or goat because fat is the LORD's portion, and whoever eats it shall be cut off from his people.

questions.question: What is the instruction given in Leviticus 7 concerning the consumption of blood?
options: No blood of fowl or beast shall be eaten in dwellings
Blood may be consumed if properly salted
Blood is to be poured on the altar only
Blood consumption is permitted during festivals
questions.correctAnswer: No blood of fowl or beast shall be eaten in dwellings
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:26-27 clearly prohibits eating any manner of blood of fowl or beast within dwellings, with the penalty of being cut off from the people.

questions.question: What ritual portions from the peace offerings are assigned to the priests according to Leviticus 7?
options: The wave breast and the heave shoulder
The rump and the kidneys
The skin and the fat
The whole burnt offering
questions.correctAnswer: The wave breast and the heave shoulder
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:30-34 describes that the wave breast and the heave shoulder are given by statute to Aaron and his sons as their portion from the peace offerings.

questions.question: True or False: In Leviticus 7, the priest must personally bring the offerings of the LORD made by fire, including fat and breast, for the wave offering.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:30 states that the offerer’s own hands shall bring the offerings, including the fat with the breast, for the wave offering before the LORD.

questions.question: How is the concept of holiness emphasized in the consumption and handling of the trespass offering in Leviticus 7?
options: It is most holy and to be eaten only by priests in the holy place
It can be eaten by anyone at any time
It is to be shared with the poor outside the camp
It must be completely burned and not eaten
questions.correctAnswer: It is most holy and to be eaten only by priests in the holy place
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:1,6 stress that the trespass offering is most holy and that every male among the priests shall eat it in the holy place, highlighting its sacredness.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the legal and cultic function of the peace offerings in Leviticus 7, including their relation to the priestly office?
options: Peace offerings include thanksgiving and vow offerings, with portions designated for priests as a perpetual statute
Peace offerings are only for sin atonement and the entire flesh is burned
Peace offerings are voluntary and have no specific portions for priests
Peace offerings are only eaten by the congregation and not the priests
questions.correctAnswer: Peace offerings include thanksgiving and vow offerings, with portions designated for priests as a perpetual statute
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:11-36 lays out laws for peace offerings including thanksgiving and vow offerings, specifying portions for priests like the breast and shoulder, given as a statute forever.

questions.question: Considering the historical and cultural context, what might be the reason Leviticus 7 prohibits eating fat and blood, and requires specific portions for priests?
options: To maintain ritual purity and honor the LORD by reserving certain parts for Him and the priesthood
To prevent food poisoning from fatty or bloody meat
To encourage sharing food with neighbors
To avoid competition between tribes
questions.correctAnswer: To maintain ritual purity and honor the LORD by reserving certain parts for Him and the priesthood
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:23-27 shows that fat and blood are set apart for the LORD, reflecting ancient Near Eastern purity laws and the sanctity of offerings, with priests receiving designated portions to maintain holiness.

theological.title: Leviticus Chapter 7 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Leviticus Chapter 7 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Leviticus 7, what is the status of the trespass offering in terms of holiness?
options: Most holy
Common
Unclean
Ordinary
questions.correctAnswer: Most holy
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:1 states that the law of the trespass offering is 'most holy,' emphasizing its sacred and set-apart status. This holiness reflects God's purity and the need for atonement (cf. Leviticus 6:18, Hebrews 7:26, 1 Peter 1:16, Exodus 19:10).

questions.question: Where shall the trespass offering be killed according to Leviticus 7?
options: In the place where they kill the burnt offering
Outside the camp
In the holy place
At the entrance of the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: In the place where they kill the burnt offering
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:2 commands that the trespass offering be killed in the same place as the burnt offering, symbolizing the unified atonement process. This is consistent with the unified sacrificial system (cf. Leviticus 1:3, Hebrews 13:11-12, Romans 3:25, 1 John 1:7).

questions.question: Which parts of the trespass offering's animal fat are to be burned on the altar?
options: The rump, fat covering the inwards, two kidneys, fat on them by the flanks, and the caul above the liver
Only the fat on the back
The entire animal except the skin
Only the kidneys
questions.correctAnswer: The rump, fat covering the inwards, two kidneys, fat on them by the flanks, and the caul above the liver
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:3-5 specifies these fat portions are to be burned on the altar as an offering by fire to the LORD, highlighting God's demand for the best and choicest parts in sacrifice (cf. Genesis 4:4, Leviticus 3:3-4, Hebrews 13:11, Isaiah 6:6-7, Romans 12:1).

questions.question: Who is permitted to eat the flesh of the trespass offering and where must it be eaten?
options: Every male among the priests, and it shall be eaten in the holy place
Any Israelite, anywhere
Only the high priest, outside the camp
Levites only, in the courtyard
questions.correctAnswer: Every male among the priests, and it shall be eaten in the holy place
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:6 states that every male priest shall eat the trespass offering in the holy place, indicating a special sacred privilege and restriction to maintain reverence and purity (cf. Leviticus 10:14, Numbers 18:8-9, Hebrews 7:5, 1 Corinthians 9:13).

questions.question: What is the relationship between the sin offering and the trespass offering according to this chapter?
options: They share the same law and the priest who makes atonement shall have it
They are completely different and unrelated
The sin offering is voluntary, trespass offering is mandatory
Only the sin offering is most holy
questions.correctAnswer: They share the same law and the priest who makes atonement shall have it
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:7 indicates that the sin offering and trespass offering are governed by one law, and the priest who makes atonement with them shall have the offering, showing the unity of atonement and priestly rights (cf. Leviticus 6:18, Hebrews 9:22, Romans 3:25, 1 John 2:2).

questions.question: Which parts of the peace offering are given to the priests as their portion?
options: The breast and the right shoulder
The head and the tail
The fat only
The kidneys and liver
questions.correctAnswer: The breast and the right shoulder
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:30-34 describes the breast is waved and the right shoulder is given to the priests as their heave offering and portion, symbolizing the priestly share in the offering and God's provision for their service (cf. Numbers 18:8-9, Deuteronomy 18:3, 1 Corinthians 9:13-14, Ephesians 5:2).

questions.question: What is commanded concerning the fat of ox, sheep, and goat in Leviticus 7?
options: You shall eat no manner of fat of these animals
You may eat all fat freely
Only the fat on the kidneys may be eaten
Fat must be given to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: You shall eat no manner of fat of these animals
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:23 commands the Israelites to eat no fat of ox, sheep, or goat, as the fat belongs to the LORD for offerings and signifies sacredness (cf. Leviticus 3:17, Deuteronomy 12:23, Romans 3:25, Hebrews 9:14).

questions.question: What consequence is given for anyone who eats blood, according to Leviticus 7?
options: That soul shall be cut off from his people
They shall be fined
They shall offer a sin offering
There is no consequence
questions.correctAnswer: That soul shall be cut off from his people
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:26-27 states that whoever eats any blood shall be cut off from his people, reflecting the sanctity of life in the blood and God's prohibition against profaning it (cf. Genesis 9:4, Leviticus 17:11, Acts 15:20, Hebrews 9:22).

questions.question: The flesh of the peace offering for thanksgiving must be eaten when?
options: The same day it is offered and none left until morning
Within three days
Only on the third day
Anytime within a week
questions.correctAnswer: The same day it is offered and none left until morning
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:15 commands the flesh of the peace offering for thanksgiving to be eaten the same day, with none remaining until morning, indicating the immediacy and joy of communion with God (cf. Exodus 12:10, Leviticus 19:5, 1 Corinthians 11:26).

questions.question: What happens if the flesh of the peace offering is eaten on the third day?
options: It shall not be accepted and shall be an abomination
It is still acceptable
It must be burned by the offerer
It can be eaten if reheated
questions.correctAnswer: It shall not be accepted and shall be an abomination
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:18 warns that eating the flesh on the third day is an abomination and the soul that eats it bears its iniquity, emphasizing ritual purity and God's holiness (cf. Leviticus 19:8, Numbers 6:11, Hebrews 13:11-12, Revelation 21:27).

questions.question: Who is cut off from the people for eating the flesh of peace offerings with uncleanness upon them?
options: The soul that eats with uncleanness upon him
Only the high priest
Any stranger in the camp
No one
questions.correctAnswer: The soul that eats with uncleanness upon him
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:20-21 declares that anyone who eats the peace offering flesh having uncleanness shall be cut off, reflecting the necessity of holiness and purity before God (cf. Leviticus 5:2, Numbers 19:11-13, 1 Corinthians 11:27-29, Hebrews 12:14).

questions.question: What is the role of the priest concerning the fat and the breast of the peace offering?
options: The priest shall burn the fat on the altar, but the breast belongs to Aaron and his sons
The priest eats all the fat and breast
The priest gives the fat to the people
The priest burns both fat and breast
questions.correctAnswer: The priest shall burn the fat on the altar, but the breast belongs to Aaron and his sons
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:31 states the priest burns the fat on the altar while the breast is given to Aaron and his sons, highlighting the sacred portion reserved for the priesthood (cf. Leviticus 3:3-4, Numbers 18:8-9, Deuteronomy 18:3, 1 Corinthians 9:13).

questions.question: What must accompany a peace offering when it is offered as a thanksgiving according to Leviticus 7?
options: Unleavened cakes mingled with oil and leavened bread
Only unleavened bread
Only leavened bread
No bread is required
questions.correctAnswer: Unleavened cakes mingled with oil and leavened bread
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:12-13 commands that thanksgiving peace offerings be accompanied by unleavened cakes mingled with oil, wafers anointed with oil, and leavened bread, symbolizing joy and gratitude (cf. Exodus 12:15-20, Leviticus 23:17, Matthew 26:26, 1 Corinthians 5:7-8).

questions.question: Who must personally bring the peace offering's wave and heave offerings to the LORD?
options: The one who offers the peace offering
The Levites
The high priest only
Any Israelite may bring it
questions.correctAnswer: The one who offers the peace offering
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:29-30 states that the offerer's own hands must bring the fat with the breast as a wave offering before the LORD, emphasizing personal responsibility in worship (cf. Exodus 23:19, Deuteronomy 26:4-11, Hebrews 13:15, Philippians 2:17).

questions.question: Leviticus 7 concludes by summarizing the laws of which offerings?
options: Burnt offering, meat offering, sin offering, trespass offering, consecrations, and peace offerings
Only sin and trespass offerings
Only burnt and peace offerings
Only meat and peace offerings
questions.correctAnswer: Burnt offering, meat offering, sin offering, trespass offering, consecrations, and peace offerings
questions.explanation: Leviticus 7:37-38 summarizes that the LORD commanded Moses regarding the burnt, meat, sin, trespass offerings, consecrations, and peace offerings, showing the comprehensive sacrificial system for atonement and worship (cf. Leviticus 1:1-3, Hebrews 10:1-4, Romans 3:25, Psalm 51:16-17).
